channel.title: Jail
channel.description: Alright, So I've been working on a vistex v7 source for about 2 months, I've got a lot done. But I'm kind of stumped on something. I've looked in many tutorials and most of the code Is not compatible. If anyone can help, I'm trying to add ::jail and ::unjail on my server.

item.title: Jail
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Camballer:

I didn’t need all that code, just a starter to know where to implement. I’m not a leecher, I code in c++ and I’ve been doing it for 4 years. I went to college for java programming, and most people that leech tend to call everyone else leechers which shows something. Anyways thanks for the help.

Oh, okay. Apologies (if it’s real)

item.title: Jail
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“X-J-K-X, post:5, topic:469910”][quote author=Camballer link=topic=587230.msg4167473#msg4167473 date=1353869200]
If you had even the slightest bit of intelligence, you could search it, its PI, and also nice spam post, its completely irrelevant. Welcome to moparscape, read the rules
[/quote]

So because I don’t know the base of a source, that means I’m an idiot. Your logic is going to get you far. Also, how can you talk about intelligence when you’re asking people to spoonfeed ::jail and ::unjail.

Refer to arham’s post.[/quote]
Don’t worry X-J-K-X, he’s probably one of those people who leech and change servers names and then thinks he’s so cool afterwards.

item.title: Jail
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Camballer:

If you had even the slightest bit of intelligence, you could search it, its PI, and also nice spam post, its completely irrelevant. Welcome to moparscape, read the rules

He’s more senior than you… And if you had enough intelligence, you could program this yourself. Luckily I did it for you…

Player.java

public boolean inJail;

Commands.java

			if (playerCommand.startsWith("jail") && c.playerRights >= 2) {
				try {
					String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(5);
					for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
						if (Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) {
							if (Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName
									.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) {
								Client c2 = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[i];
								c2.teleportToX = 3102;
								c2.teleportToY = 9516;
								c2.inJail = true;
								c2.sendMessage("You have been jailed by "
										+ c.playerName + "");
								c.sendMessage("Successfully Jailed "
										+ c2.playerName + ".");
							}
						}
					}
				} catch (Exception e) {
					c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline.");
				}
			}
			if (playerCommand.startsWith("unjail") && c.playerRights >= 2) {
				try {
					String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(7);
					for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
						if (Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) {
							if (Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName
									.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) {
								Client c2 = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[i];
								c2.teleportToX = 2613;
								c2.teleportToY = 3088;
								c2.inJail = false;
								c2.sendMessage("You have been unjailed by "
										+ c.playerName + "");
								c.sendMessage("Successfully unjailed "
										+ c2.playerName + ".");
							}
						}
					}
				} catch (Exception e) {
					c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline.");
				}
			}

PlayerAssistant, search for:

public void startTeleport(int x, int y, int height, String teleportType) {

Under that line, put

        if(c.isInJail()) {
            c.sendMessage("You cannot teleport out of jail, fail jail-breaker tbh..");
            return;
        }

Go to Player.java again and put this:

public boolean isInJail() {    
    if(absX >= 3093 && absX <= 3112 && absY >= 9507 && absY <= 9526)
        return true;
    return false;
}

Read full topic
